result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A. Albrecht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 5 days to be SERVED with 25 days I&S as defendant is eligible for SSTOP program (to be supervised by ATTIC). With huber for work/treatment if defendant found eligible under jail classification system. To begin within 45 days. In effect for one year once defendant is in full compliance with drivers safety plan then he is deemed to have completed the SSTOP program.

Any vehicle titled and registered in defendant's name are ordered to have IID and is ordered on defendant himself.
IID to be installed within 14 days
EXEMPTIONS on IID order as state in court (Motorcycle and 1979 Chev truck as listed on exemption order.

for IID exemptions
faxed to DOT

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:27am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person and with Atty Rick Cveykus.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd/Repeater)>>AMEND to DELETE Repeater allegation
Ct. 2 (OAR/Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: $1379 inclusive; 30 days MCJ Total: 5 days to be served with 25 days I&S as Defendant is eligible for SSTOP Program (to be supervised by Attic), w/huber for work/treatment if defendant found eligible under jail classification system, to begin within 45 days, in effect for one year - once defendant is in full compliance with drivers safety plan then he is deemed to have completed the SSTOP program; 13 month DL Rev w/credit;  Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself, both for a period of 13 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; EXEMPTIONS on IID order as state in court (motorcycle and 1979 Chev truck) and as listed in Exemption order; AODA (Court deems completed).

Adj: 11:37am
Plea hearing on June 26, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:05am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person and with Atty Rick Cveykus.  
(Set for Tent Plea)

Parties note agreement  HAS been reached in this matter; however defendant still needs to complete assessment before he can take advantage of SSTOP offered program, and will be completed by June 25.
COURT directs parties to set plea/sentencing at the end of June (after th 25th).

Bond continues.

Adj: 9:06am
Request For Adjournment of pre-trial conference - granted - if reset w/in 2 weeks
Pre-trial conference on May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial on July 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on July 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Shall not consume alcohol.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 on or before 04/13/15.
